Voter registration records: The expert may have checked the voter registration records in Wisconsin to verify if the claimant's name appears in the records for each year they claimed to have voted.
Election participation history: The expert may have examined the historical election participation data in Wisconsin to determine if the claimant's voting record aligns with their assertion of voting every year.
Witness testimonies: The expert may have sought testimonies from individuals who personally witnessed the claimant voting in Wisconsin elections to corroborate their claim.
Documentation evidence: The expert may have requested the claimant to provide any relevant documentation, such as voting receipts or confirmation letters, to support their claim of voting in Wisconsin each year.
